org.matrix.androidsdk.crypto

Class MXCrypto

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.matrix.androidsdk.crypto.MXCrypto

  • public class MXCrypto
extends Object
    A `MXCrypto` class instance manages the end-to-end crypto for a MXSession instance.

    Messages posted by the user are automatically redirected to MXCrypto in order to be encrypted before sending. In the other hand, received events goes through MXCrypto for decrypting. MXCrypto maintains all necessary keys and their sharing with other devices required for the crypto. Specially, it tracks all room membership changes events in order to do keys updates.

        public void start(boolean isInitialSync,
                  ApiCallback<Void> aCallback)
        Start the crypto module. Device keys will be uploaded, then one time keys if there are not enough on the homeserver and, then, if this is the first time, this new device will be announced to all other users devices.
        Parameters:
        aCallback - the asynchronous callback

        Parameters:

        timeline - the id of the timeline where the event is decrypted. It is used to prevent replay attack.

      • checkUnknownDevices

        public void checkUnknownDevices(List<String> userIds,
                                ApiCallback<Void> callback)
        Check if the user ids list have some unknown devices. A success means there is no unknown devices. If there are some unknown devices, a MXCryptoError.UNKNOWN_DEVICES_CODE exception is triggered.
        Parameters:
        userIds - the user ids list
        callback - the asynchronous callback.

      • setGlobalBlacklistUnverifiedDevices

        public void setGlobalBlacklistUnverifiedDevices(boolean block,
                                                ApiCallback<Void> callback)
        Set the global override for whether the client should ever send encrypted messages to unverified devices. If false, it can still be overridden per-room. If true, it overrides the per-room settings.
        Parameters:
        block - true to unilaterally blacklist all
        callback - the asynchronous callback.

      • getGlobalBlacklistUnverifiedDevices

        public boolean getGlobalBlacklistUnverifiedDevices()
        Tells whether the client should ever send encrypted messages to unverified devices. The default value is false. This function must be called in the getEncryptingThreadHandler() thread.
        Returns:
        true to unilaterally blacklist all unverified devices.

      • getGlobalBlacklistUnverifiedDevices

        Parameters:
        callback - the asynchronous callback

        Parameters:
        roomId - the room id
        Returns:
        true if the client should encrypt messages only for the verified devices.
